subject: Re: [junit] Query about passing parameters from @Suite to Junit file
messageBody:
Hi,

@RunWith(Parameterized.class)?

http://www.testearly.com/2007/04/13/take-heed-of-mixing-junit-4s-parameterized-tests/

Thanks.




2008/12/2 Deepankar <deepankar.narang@...>

> Hi,
>
> The junit files would be called through the Junit Suite and this is Suite
> would be part of some standard build process. The only possible way is to
> pass parameters from Suite to junit class.
>
> There is one more way, if somehow I could Identify the name of the class in
> which Suite is been created in my Junit class file.
>
> Thanks
>
>
> On Mon, Dec 1, 2008 at 9:57 PM, Scott Glaser <sglaser@...<sglaser%40yahoo-inc.com>>
> wrote:
>
> > Could you use System Properties? You can pass the values on the command
> > line (-Dkey1=value1 -Dkey2=value2)
> >
> > Scott
> >
> > ________________________________
> >
> > From: junit@yahoogroups.com <junit%40yahoogroups.com> <junit%
> 40yahoogroups.com> [mailto:
> > junit@yahoogroups.com <junit%40yahoogroups.com> <junit%40yahoogroups.com>]
> On Behalf Of
> > Deepankar
> > Sent: Friday, November 28, 2008 3:41 AM
> > To: junit@yahoogroups.com <junit%40yahoogroups.com> <junit%
> 40yahoogroups.com>
>
> > Subject: [junit] Query about passing parameters from @Suite to Junit
> > file
> >
> >
> > Hi,
> >
> > I have a small issue. I am using Junit 4 and trying to call a junit file
> > from test Suite.
> >
> > *The Suite file* is as follows:-
> >
> > *import org.junit.runner.RunWith;
> > import org.junit.runners.Suite;
> >
> > @RunWith(Suite.class)
> > @...( {EmployeeTest.class})
> > public class EmployeeTestAMAllTests {
> > }*
> >
> > *Junit Test Class*
> >
> > *import org.junit.After;
> > import org.junit.Before;
> > import org.junit.Test;
> >
> > public class EmployeeTest {
> >
> > public EmployeeTest(String AM_NAME, String VO_NAME) { //How
> > to pass them from the test suite?
> > super(AM_NAME, VO_NAME);
> > }
> >
> > @Before
> > public void setUp() throws Exception {
> > setUpBefore();
> > }
> > @Test
> > public void createRecord() {
> > testCreateRecord();
> > }
> >
> > @After
> > public void tearDown() throws Exception {
> > tearDownAfter();
> > }*
> >
> > The issue I am facing is that I need to pass parameters from the Test
> > Suite
> > to the Junit Test Class file for the instantiation of the file. Can
> > anyone
> > please help me in this as it is very urgent.
> >
> > Thanks In advance :-)
> >
> > Regards,
> > Deepankar
> >
> > [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
> >
> > [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
> >
> >
> >
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
>
>
